title: J3D6: Wall thermal breaks of a sole-occupancy unit of a Class 2 building or a Class 4 part of a building

contentBlocks.title: Wall Thermal Break Requirements
items: A metal-framed wall that forms part of the building envelope must have a thermal break, consisting of a material with an R-Value of not less than R0.2, installed at all points of contact between the external cladding and the metal frame if the wall:
(a) does not have a wall lining or has a wall lining that is fixed directly to the same metal frame; and
(b) is clad with weatherboards, fibre-cement or the like, or metal sheeting fixed to a metal frame.

contentBlocks.title: Exceptions
items: The requirements above do not apply to walls constructed using insulated sandwich panels.

contentBlocks.title: Definition
contentBlocks.text: R-Value: The thermal resistance of a component calculated by dividing its thickness by its thermal conductivity, expressed in mÂ².K/W.
